abstract: Antonio Cassese, a prominent Italian jurist who helped found two international war-crimes tribunals and who was often described as the chief architect of modern international criminal justice, dies at age 74.
snippet: The founder of two war-crimes tribunals, Mr. Cassese played a vital role in creation of a modern system of international criminal justice.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia

lead_paragraph: The founder of two war-crimes tribunals, Mr. Cassese played a vital role in creation of a modern system of international criminal justice.

headline.main: Antonio Cassese, War Crimes Law Expert, Dies at 74
headline.print_headline: Antonio Cassese, War Crimes Law Expert, Dies at 74
headline.seo: Antonio Cassese, Noted Italian Jurist, Dies at 74
